website_summaries.verdict: Other extension grabbers are often designed as mobility aids, but this versatile model can also be used for heavier duty assignments, such as yard cleanup or garbage disposal.
pros: Magnetic tip and rubber grips improve security
Grips heavy or bulky items securely
Ergonomically designed trigger – not a pistol grip
cons: Hard rubber tips can lose grip
Heavy and requires significant wrist strength in certain positions

customer_reviews.title: Not that good
customer_reviews.text: An absolute ergonomic nightmare! Get the pistol grip style. These have a strong grip, but only if you're positioned perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: joe customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product but select the proper size.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the 36” one to pick up litter for 17 years. It is still working fine. I bought my neighbor the 48” so he could pick up sticks without leaving his lawn tractor. I tried using the 48” and it is too long to allow you to drop the litter in a bag you are holding. However the 48” works great for him, as he picks up sticks and tosses them in the cart behind his tractor. I don’t know if there are better grabbers out there but I don’t know how this one can be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is not for people with arthritis in their hands. I bought one for my mother and it is very difficult for her to squeeze the handle to pick up items. I tried it too and it is difficult to squeeze for me. I tried to send it back but Amazon stated it was not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Reese

customer_reviews.title: Broken Nifty Napper
customer_reviews.text: Was damaged in shipping, looks like something fell on it and bent the box and the nabber inside the box. My thoughts are not very protected inside box for shipping. Could be protected better. Then i went to order it again after going through return process, and the price went up $3.00 wow. I will rate the new one, i know they work great we use them at work every day.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. Hites

customer_reviews.title: Very long but if that’s what you want it is perfect
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this was way too long - I didn’t actually measure/think about the length ... but after having back surgery and not being able to bend at all it has been a life saver!!! The grips are really good - even using it to pick up and lower back down dog food bowls which are heavy - like a small fiesta ware bowl. It also has a magnet on the side of the grip so that is handy once in awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Product damaged. Tried to choose returning it, but got "this item is not eligible for return"
customer_reviews.author: H. Al-sayed

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy. The handle does not effectively convey grip pressure applied to it to the pincer mechanism. It doesn't seem to assist in moving even light objects. I returned it (effortlessly).
customer_reviews.author: Randall Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and difficult to grip
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other similar pickup tools I've used, this one is heavy and is difficult to hold after a small amount of use. After using it last weekend to pick up trash during my walks, it was a strain on my hand and wrist. The weight of this tool also makes it more difficult to control what you are picking up, as it feels like you are struggling to just hold the tool steady, again due to the weight. I also do not like the handle mechaninsm, as it seems ergonomic, but is actually just awkward. I would not purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Croy

customer_reviews.title: My blabber about a nabber
customer_reviews.text: Eh...I find myself having to use a stepstool anyway. I'm short and thought this would be helpful reaching things in my cabinets. Do NOT try to pick up a jar (like spaghetti sauce). I almost had a disaster. And the claws need room to grasp items. So if your cereal boxes (for instance) are all abutting and there's no wiggle room..it's not going to work. So I don't know if I'm knocking this specific product or just the concept in general. Might be better suited for picking light objects off of the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Shopazon

customer_reviews.title: RETURNED IT!
customer_reviews.text: Does not securely grab items from shelves. Tried removing an item from top cabinet shelf using the grabber but the item was not secured an it was ready to slip out of the grip when I hurriedly returned it to shelf thus avoiding a serious mishap. Be forewarned, don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Peters64

customer_reviews.title: The length is outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked as to be expected. the length is perfect and is very easy to use. Do have a problem with its sturdiness or strength. I found that do to it being lightweight and the length if you try to pick up anything some what heavy it will bend in the middle and the claws will bend out of alignment then you can't pick up things because the two ends don't meet flush.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L.

customer_reviews.title: good grip
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tool. I use it primarily in the home work shop to get things off high shelves. I had/have an old and very cheap one which has a partially broken grabber , This one works much better than the old one ever did. It works well picking things up off the floor as well. Some reviewers prefer a trigger type handle and noted this one has to be held one way to properly work. This is true. It's a matter of personal preference. I like this style..
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for yard work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be able to pick up small tree branches and litter along the roadside while on my lawn mower. Rather than having to stop, shut off the blades, set the parking brake and climb on and off the mower, I simply pause reach out with the grabber and pick up whatever it is laying on the ground. Saves me time as well as my back! I had an "el cheapo" grabber from Harbor Freight and while it served it's purpose, it was a light duty device and soon broke a spring making it less easy to use. So far this Unger grabber seems to be much more solid while remaining light in weight.
customer_reviews.author: Enough's Enough

customer_reviews.title: Easy easy easy to use and will pick up almost anything and it picks up heavy items also
customer_reviews.text: Love my grabber works so well just had my second total knee replacement ,wish id of thought to buy one with the first knee replacement ,i hate puttimg people out ,this helps you do so much more for yourself this product has made my life so much easier while recuperating and im.sure your caretakers appreciate it also ,its actually pretty to and when im.all well i can use it instead of dragging out a stepstool ,this product works really well and is easy to use as i have really bad arthritis of the hands this is easy to sqeeze and doesnt hurt my hands .
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Stone

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product because it is very sturdy. That being said, it is a good bit heavier than the one I use inside, so I’ll have to get used to it’s weight. Also, the handle is different, but I think it is more durable than the other style handle (the other style handle was always the first thing to break). I do a lot of yard work, so this really saves my back! Great product - great price.
customer_reviews.author: UofAlabamaFan

customer_reviews.title: Odd Design
customer_reviews.text: I was drawn to this teacher due to its purported strength, but ultimately found it awkward to use. I can imagine it would be difficult or painful for people with arthritis. The mechanics might be appealing for some, but did not improve my experience over traditional and cheaper designs. It is not great at grabbing things like paper or small, thin, lightweight objects, but can handle heavier items than many reachers. It was still not strong enough to securely pick up large ceramic dog bowls, but maybe I was expecting too much. I do appreciate the length and now keep it near the washer and dryer to help me retrieve docks and other stuff that goes overboard.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie C.

customer_reviews.title: Only Grabber Tool You'll Ever Need!!
customer_reviews.text: I swear by this Grabber!! If your looking for something like this then get this one. It's the cream of the crop, best of the best. You will never need a different one. My last nifty nabber lasted over 6 years. I'll only ever buy this brand. Must have!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff webb

customer_reviews.title: My Trash Picker of Choice for Creeks!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my picker of choice!!! I'm Creek Runner 242 and I pull trash out of local creeks. When me cheapo trash picker broke I knew I needed something heavy duty, something that could take a lickin' and keep on pickin'!!!! A lot of what I pull is in the water so plastic and debris can be relatively heavy. This bad boy hasn't failed me yet and I've been picking with it for a couple of months now! It does some serious work there's a reason why it's professional grade!!!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Eades

customer_reviews.title: TRIGGER STICKS
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I received the product, I began testing it. I love the length and seemingly durability but that is all I like. The handle is unwieldy and not ergonomic. The trigger sticks closed 95 to 98% of the time and unsticking it hurts my hand. There are magnets in the tips but they do not engage so these are not the reason the trigger sticks. Wish it were as advertised because I could really use it to help clean up my neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: T. McTier

customer_reviews.title: A good grabber
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 36" grabber and it works great. I picked up the trash in our community park, a 55 gallon bag full, and the grabber made it easy on my back and it was easy to use. It will even pick up small pieces, like gross cigarette butts and small wrapper pieces, with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Carlton Moore Realtor

customer_reviews.title: Drops far more items than it picks up!
customer_reviews.text: This reacher is good for picking up water glasses, but it drops just about everything else. I say it's a defective design. Can not pick up my TV remote, my iPhone, and even has trouble picking up my iPad. it drops my medicine bottles, can't pick up coins or anything flat. Piece of junk. Get the plastic ones with the little flaps alongside the grabber. They pick up everyting, even coins and small medicine pills. Only problem with them is that they break more easily if you lean down on them like a cane. So don't do that and it'll last quite a long time. But do not buy the piece of garbage metal one that I just reviewed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Good yard tool
customer_reviews.text: This is great for yard clean-up! That's the thing I like most but the thing that I like the least is the length and the difficulty in squeezing the handle. The handle requires more strength than I have in my hands and arms due to an injury. For someone with a good grip, it would be perfect. It is really good at picking up branches and pine cones as well as other debris in the out-of-doors. In the future, I am hoping that I will become more adept at operating the handle by loosening it to some degree. Nevertheless, I would recommend this grabber.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Too Heavy and Can't Return
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the product for my elderly mother who is wheelchair bound. The product looked a lot sturdier than the plastic ones I've seen at our local pharmacy. However, that sturdiness comes at a price, which is weight. It's heavier than the plastic models and poorly balanced requiring a lot of forearm strength to control. The Seller was Amazon Services, LLC and when I tried to return using the "Item doesn't work" option, I was told it was not eligible. I guess I'll donate it to someone who doesn't mind the weight, but I would hate to have received one that was DOA and then couldn't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ohana of 3Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Best Grabber Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Wife's account here. I've purchased many different types of reach tools. Most of which have fallen apart or could not provide adequate gripping power. The Unger Nifty Nabber is far and away the best! Durable and strong, it will lift bulky and heavy items and the jaws are able to retrieve small flat objects as well. The tips, if bent, are easily restored by applying slight twisting pressure. The hand grip / trigger is also well designed. Ergonomic and very comfortable to use. I own two and have had my oldest one for two years and it has never failed me. It still preforms as well as my newer unit.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Seems great so far
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this grabber so I could hand out Halloween treats without getting too close to trick-or-treaters (COVID-19). I haven't used it for its purpose, yet, but I can tell this is a better grabber than my old one. The handle is aluminum. The claw end looks like it has plenty of surface area to get a good grip on stuff. There is even a magnet on one side to help you grab dropped keys. I'm not so sure about the grip, though. The position seems like it might be a little awkward. Also, the handle length isn't adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Nit Secyre: No Locking Mechanism on Handle Grip
customer_reviews.text: Not secure for retrieving cups or books etc. It has no locking mechanism on the handle, so when you have grabbed an item from high shelf, if your grip loosens, even a tiny bit, the clasps open and you get bonked in the head as the mug comes flying down!
customer_reviews.author: RealNews

customer_reviews.title: The
customer_reviews.text: I use grabbers all the time. I am partially disabled and have one by the table where I sit most of the day and one in the kitchen. The one by my table broke and it was not warranted again, so I bought this one which has a mush stronger gripping power than the others I have or ever had. Plus, it is so much longer than the other ones and heavier too. This is a quality grabber with a lifetime warranty. I am happy. Also, the grabber at the end COME TOGETHER PERFECTLY EVERY TIME. I HAVE NEVER HAD ONE DO THIS. THIS IS THE GRABBER!
customer_reviews.author: FRANK M COHEN

customer_reviews.title: Not something you use everyday but well worth the money when you need it!!
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these years ago and it survived almost everything in comparison to other brands that friends and family had. Saved me in multiple situations when an object was out of reach. Definitely, a must have in any household. It may not get used every day; but be sure that you are glad you have it for those times of need. The quality seems better than many I have seen and it seems to be a little longer than some others as well. I only replaced my original, (that I got back in the late 90's), because it was lost when we moved. Delivery was very prompt and right on time.
customer_reviews.author: Magfrey40

customer_reviews.title: It found its way to my junk pike!
customer_reviews.text: I would have hoped it would grab a light bulb. No, not this one. It let go of three light bulbs. I have two ceiling fans that use 3 bulbs. It seemed like a well-made grabber but unfortunately it had one critical problem in its design. It slipped over and over when I had to remove or screw in bulbs. Man, that's irritating as Hell to spend good money on a piece of junk. I had to grab them as hard as possible and it was a waste of time. Such a simple objective and it couldn't do it. All this handicapped equipment everyone makes does everything but help. This is no different.
customer_reviews.author: Gterrier3

customer_reviews.title: Worse product ever.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this grabber. I have 17 acres, which means I have to pick up a lot of pine cones and sticks constantly. My old grabber finally wore out, so when I saw this one on Amazon, I ordered it. Worse move on my part. This thing is totally inefficient. The awkward handle is miserable on the hands; total ergonomic disaster. The grabber itself is sturdy and put together well, but the handle mechanism is cheap plastic that broke after one day. It was a nightmare to use; I'll stick to the trigger mechanisms and throw this turkey in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: This item apparently is not returnable !
customer_reviews.text: Jaws were to narrow for the item i wanted to grab so i tried to return it they would not let me. Im stuck with a useless item. I guess its time for me to cancel my Amazon prime. !!
customer_reviews.author: GREG_LKN

customer_reviews.title: CAME DAMAGED, OTHERS HAVE RHE SAME PROBLEM TOO
customer_reviews.text: This product probably works well but cake damaged and they charged me full price. Others have had the same issue I see. This seller doesn’t like to inspect anything before he/sends it out, just weird.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tony

customer_reviews.title: Not terribly useful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the GrabIt Reacher Tool, which got broken by accident after two years of good use. I can't stand this one. It doesn't pick up credit cards, coins, remotes, cell phones, anything useful. It does a good job reaching things on high shelves but for day to day use for people with mobility issues who can't pick stuff up off the floor it's not good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy reach/grab
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased mainly to grab dishes that had found their way down a slope behind an outside cat enclosure. It easily handled the paper and plastic dishes, but also grabbed hand held heavier glass dishes and bowls. The grip felt secure without having to squeeze the handle with great force. The rubber coating on the grippers made grabbing the glass and holding on to it an easy chore. Very happy with the purchase! It will get lots of use rescuing dishes but also inside for grabbing items on top shelves.
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: I found this handle VERY HARD to use
customer_reviews.text: Am disabled and have multiple grabbers with different handles and pick up areas - this one is IMPOSSIBLE for me to use- it is SO HARD to clutch it - get power to pick stuff up. Used it for a couple months, threw it out and replaced it with a different one. Appreciated how sturdy it was - but of no use if you have to angle your hand at an impossible angle to use.
customer_reviews.author: felicity

customer_reviews.title: Some times you can use another 4 feet of reach.
customer_reviews.text: When I mow with my lawn mower, I keep one of these with me to pick up things in the yard. Better than old way. Old way was stop mower, get off mower, pick thing up, get back on mower, start mower, continue mowing. Now I remain seated, reach out and pick it up, continue mowing.
customer_reviews.author: nhoj odarroc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! Slightly awkward grip.
customer_reviews.text: I was very happily pleased when this arrived -- it seems designed to last a long time, is relatively lightweight, easy to hold and use, and picks up whatever I want, weight limited, of course. All the materials seem first-rate. One caveat -- The 36" length is sometimes awkward and a little too long, but I can't complain about the reach it provides. I also have a shorter grabber by another brand, and it is easier to navigate, but doesn't have the reach, of course, nor the robust build of this grabber. It will pick up a half-gallon container, but needs two hands on the pole as the weight at the end of 36" is very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: c waller

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy, and its not returnable
customer_reviews.text: I was using a different lightweight plastic one and broke 2 of them so I thought this one would be better because it has some metal components on it. Wow, am I surprised to find out that the lightweight plastic ones I had been using for 10 bucks each are better than this one. They pick up and grab better. So, I couldn't pick up things with this, so I tried to return it only to find out it says "not returnable". Don'y buy it!
customer_reviews.author: The Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Truth be told, not!
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it is a great grabber but I received this; Thank you for submitting a customer review on Amazon. After carefully reviewing your submission, your review could not be posted to the website. While we appreciate your time and comments, reviews must adhere to the following guidelines, - just told the truth about shipping
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Love...Love...Love This Tool!
customer_reviews.text: As the title shows, I am crazy about my new tool! I purchased the 36" length to pick up trash on the sidewalk in front of the house and in the front yard. It performs well, picking up everything from a cigarette, paper, and soda cans. The item was packaged very well. No assembly required. The grip is sturdy yet comfortable. It even has a hole for hanging on a hook. I am very pleased with the product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: A 2 Z

customer_reviews.title: I really like these
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product so much, I have purchased three of them for trash pickup. All three are working great, oldest one is over 10 years old. These are built pretty sturdy and you can push into some fairly tough bushes. The rubber tipped claws gives it the ability to easily pick up small objects, yet the claw can pick up fairly heavy items. The squeeze handle is very ergonomically designed, makes for a natural and comfortable operation (at least for me). I' m 6'3" and the 36" provides enough reach without stooping or bending at the waist.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Junk that can't be returned.
customer_reviews.text: This item does not work. It does not pick up items as described. The previous Unger I had with the rotating head was much, much better. Also the push handles is awkward to use. I was disappointed that this could not be returned as almost every item I order on Amazon. It is not a hazardous product like paint thinner or something. Why can't it be returned??? I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LBG

customer_reviews.title: The small magnests in the claw end are slightly useful, but not very strong
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this device to assist while recovering from a back surgery. Comes in very handy for everything from picking things off the floor, picking things out of a cupboard, and even getting dressed! The small magnests in the claw end are slightly useful, but not very strong, so I wouldn't expect them to pick up anything more than a few ounces.
customer_reviews.author: 09RT

customer_reviews.title: My husband can not live without this!
customer_reviews.text: Well this is the 5th one purchased! Not because they broke. Very sturdy and strong. So much better than the cheap ones. My husband has knee and back problems so he has one outside, in the laundry room, in his bedroom and in the RV. Now my daughter was having problems bending to pick up her toddler toys because she is 9 months pregnant. I bought one for her and she loves it! Makes such a huge difference for those having trouble bending. Get the job done without the strain or pain. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, and good looking
customer_reviews.text: Liked the sturdy quality and the wide availability of this grabber. There is no suction needed, but pick up is good. I was also hoping to pull weeds, but it only pulls easy weeds. Tough weeds slip thru grabbers. But once you pull the weeds up, the task to pick up the weeds is great especially on concreate. Better than expected. I will more uses as time progress.
customer_reviews.author: Al Dever

customer_reviews.title: Not that I'm getting old or anything, but this grabber makes it easier on my back!
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, easy to use, and the jaws have a good grip. Can't say anything yet about durability, but it appears well constructed. Makes it easy for picking up small trash like cigarette butts along the road, as well as reaching small items high on my garage shelves without having to drag out my ladder. The 36-inch reach is just right for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: HokieFan

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy and difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: I choose this item because it was about four inches longer than the average grabber and seemed more sturdy. It was also more expensive than the other grabbers listed on the site. I wish I had gone with cheaper version, however. I found this grabber heavy and difficult to use. I found out too late that this item is not eligible for returns so I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: The BEST quality grip extender on the market
customer_reviews.text: Firm, sure gripping faces and good grip strength transfer to the gripper jaws make this gripper suitable for almost all indoor and most outdoor gripping duties. From picking up towels to assistance to put on socks and shoes to picking small branches and litter in the yard (and lets not forger that proverbial socket that WILL roll to the most inaccessible corner under the car!), this is the gripper for you. Well made of aluminum, should last for a LONG time.
customer_reviews.author: Jody A.

customer_reviews.title: Arm extender
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a tool to access things that were out of reach. I got this a few days ago and it's already my favorite tool. I use it all the time. It seems well made and it can grab things that are pretty heavy. I was able to reach some things that had fallen behind and under large pieces of furniture. I just used it along with a Kleenex to squish a moth that was taunting me from the ceiling. It's probably good if you have mobility issues, but it's great even if you don't. I'm happy that I picked the 36 inch model because it's not too long. It seems just right.
customer_reviews.author: John McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Guess I'll still be looking for another that is easier on my hand and has fingers reaching forward like the cheap ones I've been getting from the Dollar ...
customer_reviews.text: it is a little hard on the hand after some 30 squeezes, and I was hoping the fingers would be reaching out rather than in. Guess I'll still be looking for another that is easier on my hand and has fingers reaching forward like the cheap ones I've been getting from the Dollar Store. (they work great, but break after about 2 or 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: thomas  huelster

customer_reviews.title: NOT ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: The grip is very awkwardly placed and the whole thing is too long and heavy at the far end and places too much strain on your wrist. Ok for occasional use but probably will actually injure your wrist if you're using it for repetitive movements like trash pick up.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: In order to use this you have proof twist your wrist so it is very painful for me and the gripping power is horrible which defeats the purpose of the item itself. what I usually do is because it's so tall which is the one nice thing about it. I use it to knock other items to the ground and then pick it up with my other grabber
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Grabber not a scution product
customer_reviews.text: I have four of these and one of the rubber grabbers claw covers cracked and became useless. Amazon sent out a replacement and so far all good. These are amazing you can pickup some very tiny items from a floor such a s tiny pill or a piece of paper. You must be very careful not to bend or distort the metal claws as this will misalign the rubber grabbers. The metal claws can become damage or bent very easily. If you need help picking up small household items this product is great.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Saldutti

customer_reviews.title: Great for aging parents...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my parents who were using a very cheap one that came apart all the time. This one is very sturdy and easy to use. It helps out doing all their daily task. Overall a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BigRob

customer_reviews.title: Met expectations for reasonable price .
customer_reviews.text: Post surgery needed to limit bending over to pick up items. Will come in handy after the 2 week recup. time. Have cabinets that go to ceiling in kitchen. Can grab boxes of noodles and other grocery items on the top shelve with out grabbing the stool. I only gave 4 stars for sturdiness. appears to be well made but you never really know until you have something for awhile. The price of the item was 30 % less than the local hospital supply of similar items. The customer service was 20 times better than local hospital.
customer_reviews.author: hours saved

customer_reviews.title: Handle is not well made
customer_reviews.text: The handle needs to be turned around so it can be gripped with the hand instead of just the thumb. Sure, you can turn the grippers over but then it’s difficult to pick up small limbs which is why I bought it. After using for an hour, my thumb hurts from having to grip so hard. It needs a better handle for gripping!
customer_reviews.author: Reader, Tx

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This gripper works well and is great for picking up small objects because of its uniquely shaped jaws. However, I find the handle and trigger to be clumsy to hold and operate. Very sturdy shaft and all parts seem like they will be durable. With a better-designed handle, this would easily be a 5. Others might not be bothered by the handle configuration so don't let my comments prevent you from buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: One handed wonder
customer_reviews.text: This reacher is lightweight yet durable. It feels very well made but is still light enough to use one-handed. I use it for a multitude of scenarios including opening and closing some hard to reach curtains. The rubber pads on the tips of the claw give it a good grip but still protects with you're grabbing from scratches or tears. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: heavy
customer_reviews.text: its heavier than i thought and its hard to hold up and use with only one hand. I bought it for my husband to use while on the riding lawn mower and he doesnt seem to have a problem using it and steering so i guess its good
customer_reviews.author: Mtzm09

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and better than most
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of these for my workplace, and a couple other brands, and so far these haven't broken while the others have. I work in a hospital laundromat, and the grabbers help to unclog the folding machines and let the repair tech focus on stuff they're actually needed for, as well as allowing the elderly and shorter workers not to have to bend down into giant carts to get the last blankets to fold. These grabber tools are sturdy and I plan to buy a few dozen more once I can afford to.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M. Fournier

customer_reviews.title: Really helpful
customer_reviews.text: I have had reachers that are light weight, but when it comes to picking anything up a little heavy , it bends. This one is strong and that never happens. I like how you can pick things up two ways plus the gripper tip is designed to pick up a quarter, an envelope. The tip can design can also firmly grip onto other, larger things.
customer_reviews.author: MissinLondonLots

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this grabber
customer_reviews.text: I've been walking a lot more since my state started its COVID lockdown, and the trash on the side of the road was starting to bug me. I bought this grabber to pick up litter and trash during my walks, and it's worked out well for that purpose. The grabber is very light, and the ergonomics are surprisingly good. It's able to pick up everything from beer bottles to cup lids.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel delSobral

customer_reviews.title: Poor prong design
customer_reviews.text: I find the grip to be awkward and inferior to trigger style. The prongs are poorly made and bend easily. I am unable to reach feet and use grabber to pull off sweat pants, which is enough to bend the prongs. Yes they can be straightened, but after only two days use it is obvious that constant bending will soon cause them to break. This unit was purchased to replace a 32” Unger Plus from 2015 the grippers of which had worn smooth after daily use. Since packaging for new one is long gone I will eat the loss, and have ordered a replacement Unger Plus which has a vastly superior head design.
customer_reviews.author: kPhlbrck

customer_reviews.title: Really long and well made
customer_reviews.text: I was told my someone while recovering from back surgery to get the longest grabber I could. At first this seemed excessive, but it's been great. I can reach things from the floor with no bending (which as per my surgeon imn not allowed to for 8-12 weeks during recovery). And Incan easily pinch my husband with it from across the room! Really happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Caitmonster

customer_reviews.title: Great Grabber, heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: Updating my previous review. This is the best grabber ever! One, ordered from Amazon, arrived with packaging damage. Amazon sent a replacement unit. We have several grabbers. This is the best, the go-to grabber when others are inadequate. All of my previous comments are true. We're delighted with this grabber. We've bought other grabbers, some for more money, but none of them perform as well as this one. It's strong enough to pick up heavy stuff, like a sewing chest and cans of food. Now we have two, the most recent one from Amazon, and use them every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replacing last one that was over a decade old.
customer_reviews.text: I had gotten my original reacher from my mom. She's been dead over ten years. It still worked but was a bit bent out of shape due to my son being purposefully brutal on it. I ordered this one because it is the identical model. A reacher that does it's job and lasts over a decade with normal use? Sure, worth every freaking penny!
customer_reviews.author: J Sousa

customer_reviews.title: Works good, different grip from most us picker uppers. Strong rubber on jaws
customer_reviews.text: Different design from most local grabbers, probably because made in China. Feels different in hand, picks up very well. Has very good rubber grippers that don't slide and fairly large jaws that work good. Use frequently and they seem to last a long time. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: JL Rhinehart

customer_reviews.title: Grabs and keeps its hold on even very small items
customer_reviews.text: Well-constructed lightweight aluminum. I use it to grab small boxes (e.g., cereal and pasta) and cans in higher cabinets, to pick up items that fall behind washer and dryer or bookcases, etc... and (when my back is hurting) to avoid bending over to pick up sundry items from the floor. Surprisingly, it grips coins, pens, and other very small objects effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Epi

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I used to think this Unger brand was the royalty of grabbers. But two recent orders indicate by usage that the handles tend to jam and break, and that the grabbers at the bottom do not last more than a month - and I don't use them for heavy items such as cans. Does Unger have a new parts supplier? I don't know, but it would seem to. My advice: use only for picking up light items.
customer_reviews.author: A Kid's Review

customer_reviews.title: Non returnable item!
customer_reviews.text: This reaching tool is not effective for what I needed it for to be able to reach items in my closet. It simply does not work. I didn't realize when I purchased it that it was non returnable or I would not have purchased it in the first place. Beware before you buy unless you are sure it will function properly for your needs. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jklug

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I use it when I am riding the mower - to pick up branches that are in the way so I don't have to stop the mower and get off to pick them up
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lee Mondin

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware, no returns.
customer_reviews.text: I received this item missing a ribbit add a key point in the design. When I went to return it I found out it was not returnable. I paid $16.99 for the 36 inch professional Unger and it is defective. It says it's ideal for grasping items beyond your reach like your money.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty grabber, built to last
customer_reviews.text: This can pick things up without collapsing or bending like the cheap other ones. It is heavy duty so it is a little heavier then others. You can easily grab cans off shelves with the curve and angle of this grabber. I will be buying more for having 1 inside, 1 outside and 1 in the RV.
customer_reviews.author: Bowie56

customer_reviews.title: Extend Your Reach
customer_reviews.text: Another product I bought a while back and liked it so much I bought another. I use this for picking up trash in my back yard, I have over an acre lot and use this riding around in my golf cart picking up debris. Our house has 10' ceilings so our closets/pantries are very high, my wife uses this to reach items on the top shelf because she's 5'6" and can't reach them without a stool.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Fallin

customer_reviews.title: Buy Ungar grabbers and you want be disappointed with the grip.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd of this name brand that I have owned over the past 17 years. It works really well. This is the best grabber I have bought to date. I bought some that look similar to the Ungar grabber and they want grip anything. Don’t waste your money on others Ungar is the best brand .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 58 yo in good shape overall except for – knees
customer_reviews.text: Me. 58 yo in good shape overall except for – knees! Man O man, these knees. Sneaked. Used to live in the gym, runner. Well, Life happens doesn't it. Now about the product. I have a three level home. I own three grabbers. This 48 inch is perfect for really extended reach each. The quality is very good like sturdy, aluminum. I would definitely purchase this again. Do yourself a favor, get a grabber if not this one get a grabber overall! Good luck in your search, I really like this one now it's up to you
customer_reviews.author: HustonX

customer_reviews.title: Saved a worker from loosing his key.
customer_reviews.text: The first day I received it I was able to share it with our water district workman who had lost a key inside of the main valve in our front yard. I loaned the retriever to him and he found the key on the first try! I have used it to get items out of my large new washer which is deeper than my old washer! Love this!
customer_reviews.author: mazlimo

customer_reviews.title: Extender. (Or as my dog know it as: The Getter)
customer_reviews.text: I had a hip operation so getting on the floor to get things has become problematic. Its great for stuff under the couch etc. But most of all, since I am 5 foot even, I can't reach a lot of stuff at the grocery story. Often there is a tall person around but often enough I stand there trying to solve the problem...now I carry the extender with me.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little tool. We like to display our nutcrackers on the shelf high up by the ceiling for the holidays. We have 22 of them. It was very nerve wracking watching my daughter stand on furniture to place them on the shelf. I bought this just after Christmas. Boy what a life saver. She was able to easily take down each nutcracker with the Grabber, and not worry about dropping her beloved keepsakes.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Francis

customer_reviews.title: Great, save for one thing
customer_reviews.text: As I am disabled, this has been a lifesaver so many times. However, the jaws themselves are not as sturdy as they could be, and I regularly have to bend them back into place. As the metal is simple flat sheet metal, they bend relatively easily. If there was a strengthening rib, it would be so much handier. It is frustrating to try and pick up something, only to discover one of the jaws is out of alignment.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Benjamin Springer

customer_reviews.title: Great help after surgery
customer_reviews.text: I just had back surgery and can't bend or twist. I'm also very tall (6'7") so I needed a long grip stick to pick up low objects. This thing is as good as can be expected for the task. I wish it were 2" longer but I can grab things flat on the floor with the slightest bend at the knees. Better than the "trigger" style grip sticks I've used before. No problems with the gripping strength but those with weak/injured grips may have issues. It has a hard time picking up flat objects that are flat on the floor but that's to be expected. There is a small magnet on one prong but it's not on the tip.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a reacher before so I was a bit skeptical. I am happy to say that I use it frequently to get bottles of salad dressing, cans, and even big jars of salsa and jelly and never once has it dropped anything! It is important to hold the pressure firmly on the hand button but my hands aren't real strong and it is still very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does as promised--that's unusual--
customer_reviews.text: I was picking up coins on first quick efforts. I had fallen and knocked everything around and off tables while attempting to get up, making one terrible mess. I mentioned at therapy about my difficulty picking things up. They suggested this type of an item. Extremely light weight, so do not know how it will hold up. One pf my "GOOD" buys--- mike
customer_reviews.author: mike d

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like the gripper style on the handle
customer_reviews.text: At first, I didn't like the gripper style on the handle. It is a radical change from the usual Pistol Grip and Trigger that I'm accustomed to. However, I have been disabled and I use the Nifty Nabber to grab things out of reach and dropped to the floor. I pull folded blankets to me, pillows (More difficult), picked up bottler caps and bottles on the floor. Yes, I would buy it again. At first I gave this a 4 rating, but after thinking that all I had to do was change my way of gripping the handle and get used to it. Then, I give it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Harold W.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy grabber
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of grabbers being disabled. Have had it for about 6 months and it has an important place in my life. I use it to get cans and other items off of high shelfs. I've not found another grabber that I feel confident using it for this purpose. I can also rearrange items. It is long and sturdy so I can pick items up off of the floor. I use this in conjunction with my smaller grabbers to help me in the kitchen and garage. Well worth the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Holly H.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and hard to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: squeezing like this gives less control and truly hurts your hand to squeeze and try to hold this heavy wand. I hoped for more, but had to give away. Think twice about any gripper that squeezes and doesn't have a trigger like a gun because they are not ergonomically sound. Then again it might work for some, good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Bashert

customer_reviews.title: STURDY
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A STURDY PICKUP TOOL CAN PICK UP ALMOST EVERYTHING SMALL EVEN BLOOD SUGAR STRIPS FROM A TILE FLOOR "IF DON E RIGHT" BEING I N A WHEEL CHAIR IT IS PEICELESS , USE IT ASSISTING ME IN MAKING THE BED . VERY BEST I HAVE OWNED (2) /ON THE EACH SIDE OF THE HOUSE KEEPS ME FROM CARRYING ONE AROUND . NOT SUCTION POWER, HAS RUBBER GRABBERS FIXED ON THE METAL ARMS
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM FISHER

customer_reviews.title: Quality, sturdy,  but not dexterous
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Very well made quality item that will last. Very attractive and easy to handle. Have one for in the house and for outdoor use. Great for picking up most items and heavier items. Just be aware that the hard gripper doesn't have the pick-up dexterity for smaller or slender items such as remotes that are lying flat on the floor. You have to wrangle them onto their narrow edge to clasp the front and back of the remote. It's so useful and well made, I couldn't demote it a star for that , though.
customer_reviews.author: Carmelita R. Ave

customer_reviews.title: Good for small items only
customer_reviews.text: Jaws don't open very wide, so larger objects (paper towel rolls, etc - things that are light weight which are stored on a top shelf) are impossible to grab. Had to punch holes in the wrappers to make this work. Seems all like this are made the same way.
customer_reviews.author: traveler47NJ

customer_reviews.title: length is the key advantage
customer_reviews.text: These don't seem too sturdy but no problems so far. I use mine to pull down my remote cameras. I hope it remains strong- the grip on the overhead cameras is good enough but not very confidence inspiring. I'm hopeful. First delivery didn't come. Second was delivered promptly
customer_reviews.author: JHS Miami

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: If your over 65 you need this. I have used it on several occasions. Retrieving clothes behind dryer, putting up a high wreath, picking up items on the floor. The rubber tips keep thing held in its grip. A handy tool to have in any household..just get one
customer_reviews.author: J don

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for yard work!
customer_reviews.text: These work very well. I’ve bought three. One I have Velcroed atop my rider mower, to allow me to pick up stix without stopping or getting off. Another is at my second home, which has a very wooded lot, and this saves me a lot of bending when clearing the lawn of deadfall. The thrd? Well, let’s just say that on my first attempt with the tractor and Velcro innovation, are used too little Velcro. This taught me that although this is a tough item, it cannot stand up to being run over by a mower.
customer_reviews.author: TKO Man

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a grabber before. My first Impression is--this one is definitely well made, deserving the term professional. I'm 75 and not in the greatest shape. But lifting 8lbs. with this really stretches anyone's imagination no matter what shape you're in. 1 1/2 to 2lb is at least realistic. 2lb would be absolutely the max. 8lbs would most definitely bend the fingers if one were able to grip it that tight. In the real world impossible to do. It is a very good product for doing reasonable reaching task for those people that are not in best of shape. I highly recommend it for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Love these things!
customer_reviews.text: Let's start off with the fact that I'm old, got a bad back and worse knees. My rural property is heavily covered by oak trees and I use the "Nabber" to pick up fallen limbs and branches, pitching them into my Gator as I drive. This thing get's abused as I regularly grab anything it will grasp. In the shop I use it daily to retrieve dropped tools, nuts, bolts and washers, shop rags, my glasses... 'bout anything! There's little about it I would change unless they want to make a hybrid with a walking stick & hearing aid! Until then I'll happily use this model.
customer_reviews.author: C W

customer_reviews.title: I bought this grabber as I am not able to bend over like I used to
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grabber as I am not able to bend over like I used to, I got the 4-foot long model as I am tall, but it is kind of awkward to use because you also need long arms to retrieve the items you pick up. if I buy another one I will probably go with the 3-foot model, this one is quite sturdy and you can literally pick up a quarter with it, nice.
customer_reviews.author: Ken F.

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to manage & unreturns le do not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This gripper is not rasy to manage the hsndle part for mr ; alsoit does not pick tnhgs easily i don t find the rubber top Hrlpful. Another detracion is getting it to work in natrow places like beteen rhe counter and th fridge I ordred2 thinking how helpful it eould be tohsvebin differents rooms . I ewas shocked-to see theydon’t accept returns! iwrote and asked why and have not heard back yet bavk yet since i just wrote the sender
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Very handy but the grippers are fradgile
customer_reviews.text: These things are great overall and come in several lengths. Tho only real downside is the two arms or (grippers) are made of a soft metal that is easily deformed. If you drop them from even a couple feet up they can bend and you will have to straighten them out. If you do this a couple times they become harder to get lined up as the assembly that holds them becomes spread out. This is not a problem for most tasks, but when they are new you can pick up a dime with the grippers. After a couple forced "re alignments" they never come together like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: Todd in Kansas

customer_reviews.title: A Real Nifty Nabber!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best grabber I have ever owned. It is the most sturdy and can grab just about anything. The only part of it that I am not that happy with is the handle itself because I have a broken wrist that never healed right but for people with no issues they probably like it better which is how I felt when I bought it. This is actually longer than others I have and that too is a great advantage of owning this one. I highly recommend this grabber to anyone in the market for one. If you are going nuts trying to decide which one to buy, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: J. MarinoTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best one!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried reacher/grabber/nabbed out there. This is the only one that I kept. It is GREAT. You can pick up anything, even something small and flat. It really grips and holds without much hand pressure needed. It's comfortable to hold. The gripping part is curved so you can slide it under and around anything in the way. I bought 3 so I can them in different rooms where I use them every day
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Coppolino

customer_reviews.title: Nifty is an understatement!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best grabbers that I have ever used. The design of the claw is very good for picking up small and even flat items. It also has a wide "grab" so that if you need to pick-up an large item like a can or jar from a high shelf, it has no problem. The build in magnet at the tip is also a very nice touch. I thought that I would never need it, but have already used it a few times. Very well made and does what it is designed to do very well.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

product_meta.title: Unger Professional Nifty Nabber Reacher Grabber Tool and Trash Picker, 36-inch
product_meta.description:
Size:36-inchThe Unger 36-inch Nifty Nabber pick-up tool with aluminum handle makes it easy to reach items on the ground or grab items off shelves by squeezing the handle to wrap the claw around an object. The reacher can hold objects as tiny as a penny or as heavy as 8 pounds. The rubber overmolded steel fingers provide gripping power without damaging objects. The heavy duty design is perfect for trash pick-up and yardwork, but the tool is also lightweight for everyday use

AMAZON.COM
The Unger 36-inch nifty nabber pick-up tool with aluminum handle makes it easy to pick up items from the ground or off shelves by squeezing the handle to wrap the claw around an object. It can hold objects as tiny as a penny or as heavy as 8 pounds. The rubber overmolded steel fingers provide gripping power without damaging objects.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Unger 36-Inch Nifty Nabber Pick-Up Tool with Aluminum Handle #92134

See more
feature_bullets: 36-inch Nifty Nabber extends your reach low and high without the need to bend down or climb a stool or ladder
Lightweight aluminum reacher features rubber-tipped grippers to prevent damage
Long reach grabber tool features a built-in magnet to pick up metal objects
Ergonomic grip makes it easy to use
Heavy duty claw design is perfect for yard waste and litter clean up

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,007 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
